Wenn er auf diese Weise gewirkt wird, betr√§gt der DC f√ºr die Rettungsw√ºrfe dieses Zaubers 20. Alle Funkensucher im Schwarm sind gegen die Effekte dieses Zaubers immun. Sobald ein Funkensucher an einem Schwarm teilgenommen hat, der diesen Zauber gewirkt hat, kann er einen Monat lang nicht zu einem neuen Schwarm beitragen.

monster.name: Symphonic Songbird
languages: All known by its master

trait.name: Flutterby
entries: Der Symphonische Singvogel kann die Aktion Losl√∂sen als Bonusaktion ausf√ºhren.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Diese Kreatur hat einen Vorteil bei Rettungsw√ºrfen gegen Zauber und andere magische Effekte.

trait.name: Perfect Mimicry
entries: Der Singvogel kann jedes Ger√§usch, das er geh√∂rt hat, perfekt nachahmen. Eine {@dc 20} Wahrnehmungspr√ºfung zeigt, dass das Ger√§usch gef√§lscht ist.

trait.name: Shining Feathers
entries: Feindliche Kreaturen, die den Singvogel angreifen, m√ºssen einen {@dc 12} Charisma-Rettungswurf machen. Scheitern sie, geht der Angriff daneben.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage and {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) psychic damage.

action.name: Peck
entries: Recharges after a short or long rest). The symphonic songbird chirps a beautiful song. Allied creatures within 30 feet gain advantage on their next attack roll, saving throw, or ability check.

The symphonic songbird is a colorful avian creature that mimics the voices of others, and can produce a beautiful melody fit for any occasion. They seem to originate from birds that have fallen for the allure of the Perfect Chord and have been touched by the magical emanations that constantly flow from it. Infused with choral power, they speak and sing with the voices of any sounds they have heard. Oddly enough, they seem to prefer being exposed to a constant onslaught of sound when at rest, and will seek out the noisiest place around to build their nests.

Colonies of songbirds will form full orchestral symphonies, to the delight of the rare few who are granted an audience. When threatened, they dazzle and strike with wicked beaks, inspiring one another to fight with fervor and fury against all aggressors. They enjoy gifts of fruit and shiny objects, which they use to build elaborate nests. Their songs are legendary for leading travelers astray, however, and they are often viewed with mistrust and suspicion by folk in less civilized lands. Summoning a symphonic songbird involves singing, as one might expect. The brazier is lit, the incense is burned, and the summoner must begin a melody of their own creation. It must be carefully done, so that there is room for another to harmonize without interruption or disruption, and is often difficult for novices. Once the song reaches the correct moment, the fire within the brazier will coalesce into the image of a songbird, and it will begin to sing along with its new master. The summoner must continue their song to an appropriate closing, guiding the bird out from the brazier at the same time. Once it has emerged fully and is corporeal, the warlock must end the song and speak their name. The symphonic songbird will repeat the name perfectly, and then speak its own. When the warlock does the same and speaks the songbird's name in exact mimicry, the bond between familiar and master will be formed.

monster.name: Wealth Mimic (Karensee)
languages: Understands those known by its master but can't speak or write

trait.name: Aggressive Adhesion
entries: Whenever the karensee touches a creature, it can choose to adhere to them as a reaction. If it does, it sticks to the target. A creature can make a {@dc 13} Strength (Athletics) check to scrape the karensee off of them. While a karensee is adhered to a creature, it has advantage on attack rolls against that target.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Diese Kreatur hat einen Vorteil bei Rettungsw√ºrfen gegen Zauber und andere magische Effekte.

trait.name: Masterful Mimicry
entries: When the karensee touches another unit of wealth, it can use a reaction to become an identical copy of that wealth. It can attack and perform actions regardless of form or appearance, but on a turn that it has taken no actions it is immune to damage and cannot be detected by any means short of truesight.

trait.name: Pocket Jump
entries: The wealth mimic can teleport up to 15 feet as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4}) acid damage.

A deadly thing that lurks in the pockets of countless saints and villains alike, money is a tool that brings both salvation and misery. Not all funds can be trusted, however. The Currency Conspiracy has been gradually replacing the original currencies of the world with karensee, colloquially known as wealth mimics. They can take an endless number of forms, but they are restricted, unlike their larger kin. These mimics can only choose to turn into objects that appear to be of value. A gold coin, a bill, a gemstone, a necklace of pearls: all of these things are potential wealth mimics. Most of them are asleep, trapped in a singular form. They feign damage or other ill effects while they are sleeping, behaving exactly like natural materials. However, when they are awakened by eldritch magic, they come to life and attack those who sought to own them. Members of the Currency conspiracy often call and awaken wealth mimics using a ritualistic rite, but any warlock of sufficient power and knowledge can summon one.

The first steps are relatively easy. The summoner must ignite the brazier and stand adjacent to it, speaking the correct incantations. Once the fire has burned down to embers, the summoner must insert a single object of value that a wealth mimic could imitate, such as a coin or bank note.

Next, the warlock must offer blood. When a few drops are applied to the object within the brazier, the flames will flare to life once more, consuming the object and then disappearing. The ashes will begin to form together into a shape identical to that of the object, and a new wealth mimic will be born. It will speak a single word, giving itself a name. So long as that name is known by its master, it will obey perfectly, changing shape and killing on command.

Wealth mimics enjoy being fed other currency. Some scholars whisper that this is intended to give them power, but others suspect that they are simply innately cannibalistic. Those in the Conspiracy are believed to have created the wealth mimics with a built-in safety measure, in case something goes wrong with the final plan. In that instance, they would consume one another in a frenzy after being deprived of other flesh, rendering them harmless to those they could not reach.

monster.name: Wiggly Cube
languages: Understands Common and those known by its master
and can speak telepathically to creatures within 10 feet of it
but can't speak or write otherwise.

trait.name: Corrosive Form
entries: A creature that hits the cube with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage. The cube can eat through 1-inch-thick nonmagical wood or metal in one round.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Diese Kreatur hat einen Vorteil bei Rettungsw√ºrfen gegen Zauber und andere magische Effekte.

trait.name: Ooze Cube
entries: The cube occupies its entire space whenever it is Medium or larger. Other creatures can enter the space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the cube's Engulf and has disadvantage on the saving throw.

Creatures inside the cube can be seen but have total cover. A creature within 5 feet of the cube can take an action to pull a creature or object out of the cube. Doing so requires a successful {@dc 12} Strength check, and the creature making the attempt takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage.
The cube can only hold one creature equal to its size, or four creatures of one size or more smaller than itself.

trait.name: Squishy
entries: The cube is immune to falling damage.

trait.name: Transparent
entries: Even when the cube is in plain sight, it takes a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom (Perception) check to spot a cube that has neither moved or attacked. A creature that tries to enter the cubes space while unaware of it is surprised by the cube.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) acid damage.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: The cube moves up to its speed. While it does so, it can enter the spaces of other creatures. Whenever the cube enters the space of a hostile creature, and the creature is of the same size or smaller than the cube, it must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw. If it succeeds, it can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the cube. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.

On a failed save, the cube enters the creature's space, and the creature takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage and is engulfed. The engulfed creature can't breathe, is {@condition restrained}, and takes 14 ({@damage 3d8}) acid damage at the start of each of the cube's turns. When the cube moves, the engulfed creature moves with it. An engulfed creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a {@dc 12} Strength check. On a success, the creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the cube.

The wiggly cube is a small, colorful, semi-transparent ooze that gently dissolves a little of everything it touches in a quest to experience all the flavors of the multiverse. They are sent down by the greater cubes within the Convocation to learn and grow before eventually returning to the space between the planes where the Gelatinous Convocation makes its home. They're surprisingly expressive for a simple square of slime, and often bounce and jiggle to express their feelings on a topic. They enjoy consuming corpses and other dead organic material, as they learn more and more about the universe with each meal. When threatened, the cube will resort to violence with an intimidating glee, lashing out with its pseudopods and trying to goad the attacker into engaging in melee combat. Against foes smaller than itself, the cube will rush them and attempt to engulf and consume them. They speak to the minds around them with a childlike innocence even as they feast on dead mortals and beasts alike. When at rest, the cube will seek a stone surface to rest upon, and will wobble slowly back and forth in a pattern seemingly designed to entice the unwary into touching it.

trait.name: Loud Machinery
entries: The horse has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Vent Stream {@recharge 5}
entries: The horse exhales steam at a creature within 5 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 2d12}) fire damage.
{@bold Clockwork Horses} are durable, untiring mounts. However they are very complex to create and maintain, and loud when active.

trait.name: Ambusher.
entries: The jaguar has advantage on attack rolls against surprised creatures.

trait.name: Keen Smell.
entries: The jaguar has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage.
{@bold Jaguars} are jungle stalkers, suitable as mounts for goblins, halflings, gnomes, and other small folk.

trait.name: Scent Tracker.
entries: Your mastiff has advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track a creature based on smell.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell.
entries: The mastiff has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

spell.name: Augment Familiar
entries: This spell grants the caster's familiar a +2 enhancement bonus to Strength, Dexterity and Constitution (not to exceed 18), and damage reduction 2, and a +2 bonus on saving throws.

spell.name: Awaken Familiar

m.text: a gem worth at least 200 gp

entries: This spell grants the caster's familiar an intelligence and wisdom of 10, and the ability to speak and read languages of its master.

spell.name: Empower Familiar

m.text: a gem worth at least 25 gp

entries: This spell enables the caster to summon a benevolent magical force, and place it within the body of his familiar or animal companion.  This force grants the familiar certain magical powers which enable it to serve its master more effectively.  A familiar so enhanced is referred to as an empowered familiar.  This spell can only affect standard familiars, as summoned by spell {@spell find familiar} or Animal Companions.  Imps, gen, or Pact of the Chain familiars and other special familiars all have their own unique magical powers, which can not be further enhanced by this spell. Familiars must be empowered by their owners. When casting this spell, the caster may choose one of the Benefits to empower their familiar, and one power determined by their tradition (if a wizard), bloodline (if a sorcerer) or by the DM's choice.

entries.name: Wizard Tradition
entries: {@b Abjuration}: Your famliar gains an arcane ward for itself equal to its master's.
{@b Conjuration}: Minor conjuration's range and weight is doubled while within 5 ft. of your familiar
{@b Divination}: The familiar (at the GM's discression) will prevent one attack against its master, foreseeing their doom and sacrificing themself.
{@b Enchantment}: Your familiar can use your hypnotic gaze, or be used to maintain the effect if they stay within 5 ft. of the creature.
{@b Evocation}: Your familiar is automatically excluded, and at your choice can extend that protection to a creature its sharing a space.

{@b Illusion}: The familiar can affect its appearance in a way similar to the spell change self. The familiar can change its appearance with regard to its fur, feather, or skin color, can mold body features in subtle ways, or can alter its size by up to 25%, but it must retain its own essential animal form. A black cat familiar might make itself look like a smaller Siamese cat or a larger wild cat. A screech owl might conceal its species by changing the color of its feathers or the shape of its head. A weasel might give itself snow white fur to blend in with a winter environment or dark fur to be less conspicuous at night. (Granting situational advantage on Deception and Stealth checks)

{@b Necromancy}: the familiar if within 5 ft. of creature as an it action can either imposes disadvantage or advantage on death saves. Creatures that die as a result of such interaction fall under Grim Harvest's collection - regain for its master (or itself) 1hp. (and you may choose from the Undead Familiars when calling for a familiar.)
{@b Transmutation}: While your familiar is within 5 ft. of your Minor Alchemy you automatically maintain concentration.

{@b Wild Mage}: As a reaction the familiar's corporeal form is sacrified to initiate one additional roll, whose result must be kept, and cannot be influenced by ANY other factor (Bardic or DM inspiration, Lucky (feat or halfling), Guidance, etc etc). The familiar must be called forth again.

entries.name: Sorcerous Origin
entries: {@b Divine Soul}: The familiar gains a nimbus akin to a candle's light. As a reaction the familiar's corporeal form is sacrified to initate another Favored of the Gods, but the familiar cannot be summoned again until its master has completed another short of long rest.

{@b Draconic}: The familiar gains aspects of its owner's dragonic bloodline, gaining an additional 2 to its AC, and threshold 2 to its master's draconic resilience type. While in contact or sharing a space with its master, its master and it gains DR 1 for that damage type.

{@b Shadow}: The familiar is inky in color and avoids bright lights. As a reaction the familiar's corporeal form is sacrified to allow a single radiant damage attack to allow Strength of the Grave to be used, or to redice the DC by the familiar's hit points. The familiar cannot be summoned until after a long or short rest.
{@b Storm}: Your Tempestuous Magic increases its range to 30 ft., but your familiar must be at the destination.
{@b Wild}: You gain and can cast {@spell Nahal's Reckless Dweomer|DnDWikiWildMagic}. Negative effects should include the familar where feasible.
If the spell is cast again, the new casting replaces the previous benefit, additional casting will not stack.
If the caster casts this spell every day for a year (for that feature), the familiar gains the ability permanently, and the caster may now cast the spell again choosing another benefit.

spell.name: Enhance Familiar I

m.text: a figurine of the familiar worth at least 2,500 gp

entries: The caster engages in a ritual that modifies its familiar for the day. When casting the spell the caster chooses one of the following features:

entries.name: Choose One
entries: Benefit:
{@b Ability Enhancement}: +2 to one Ability score for your familiar/companion, (the score may not exceed 20 or 4 more than the familiar/companion template's maximum (whichever is greater)

{@b Caster's Friend I}: The familiar gains the innate spellcaster trait, with a spell from the following list (choosen at the time Enhance Familiar I is cast). The spell takes an action for the Familiar to cast, does not need material components, and can be cast once per short or long rest. The spell is cast as if a first (1) level spell slot and 1st level caster (where applicable). The familiar maintains concentration where such applies, and uses its masters spell proficiency bonsuses and DCs.

entries.name: Spell list
items: {@spell Absorb Elements|XGE}, (Draconic Sorcerer Only)
{@spell Bane|PHB}, (Warlock only)
{@spell Bless}, (Divine Soul Sorcerer, only)
{@spell Chaos Bolt|XGE}, (Wild Magic/Wild Mage only)
{@spell Dancing Lights|PHB}
{@spell Detect Evil or Good|XGE}

{@spell Detect Magic|PHB},  While the familiar can judge the intensity of magic detected, it cannot discern the type of magic noted, as familiars are generally unschooled in the many varieties of magic
{@spell Disguise Self|PHB}
{@spell Expeditious Retreat|PHB}
{@spell Hobble Mount|DM:BM}
{@spell Jump|PHB}, The familiar can jump (itself only) up to three times per day. Each jump has a duration of only one round.
{@spell Shield of faith|PHB}, (Divine Soul Sorcerer, or Abjuration Wizard)

entries: {@b Familiar Ambassador I} The familiar can {@spell speak with animals} (as per the Cleric/Druid/Ranger spell), provided that the animal spoken with is of the same general size and family as the familiar. A black cat could speak with any foxes, polecats etc, an owl or hawk could speak with any bird of its relative size or smaller, a toad could chat with any other similarly sized amphibians, and so on. (I know this stretches true taxonomic classification, but let's not nit-pick.) The familiar can question and gain answers from an animal spoken with, but it cannot obtain a favour or exact some service, because this power confers no magical influence over the animal. NOTE: Its master doesn't automatically understand the language. The familiar will need to work as a translator, and its intelligence will limit such.

{@b Familiar Detector}: The familiar can detect one type of metal, mineral, vegetable, or other substance, such as gold, iron, coal, diamond, catnip, wild berries, or eucalyptus (as the DM chooses). The familiar detects the substance if it is within a 30' radius of the familiar. This power can be used three times per day, with each use lasting one minute. At the DM's option, the familiar may develop an obsessive interest in the given substance. The familiar may desire to collect the substance to the exclusion of other materials or forms of wealth, and may search for the substance it covets at inopportune times.
{@b Familiar's Sense}: The range for the caster's ability to use their familiar's senses expand to 50 ft. * the caster's base proficiency bonus.
{@b Familiar Spellstore I} The familiar also functions as a backup spellbook.
{@b Familiar's Touch}: The range for the creature's ability to be used as a delivery system for touch spell extends to  50 ft. * the caster's base proficiency bonus.
{@b Pathfinder}: The familiar becomes endowed with a keen sense of direction, enabling it to identify true north.
{@b Recall}: The familiar can be dismissed as a reaction.

{@b Share Life}: While in touch contact with the familiar, as free object interaction the familiar have have hitpoints drawn from or sent to their master -- allowing the caster to regain hitpoints, or for the familiar to regain hitpoints. Neither may exceed their current MAX Hp value.
{@b Tough I}: The familiar's hp is increased to its maximum value.
If the spell is cast again, the new casting replaces its previous benefit, and additional casting will not stack any of the effects. One and only one can be active at a time.

If the caster casts this spell every day for a year (for that feature), the familiar gains the ability permanently and the material component breaks and requires a new figurine be crafted, and the caster may now cast the spell again choosing another benefit.

entries.name: NOTE for DMs:
entries: {@i As the enhancement of the familiar continues, the familiar should develop a personality that seems almost human, displaying specific traits, likes, dislikes, opinions habits and foibles. It's animal qualities also develop as its personality matures. A black cat might develop discriminating and expensive tastes in food and creature comfort; a crow might become a collector of gaudy gemstones and jewelry; and an otter might develop a frolicsome personality combining a short attention span for serious matters with a love for playful pranks.}

{@i The familiar takes on some of the alignment view and attitudes of its wizard, though leaning toward the neutral alignment, a holdover from its simple animal origin, will always remain. The familiar may tend to become more of an independent NPC as it is enhanced. The DM should carefully consider if relaxing the dependency on the wizard will improve the campaign play.}

spell.name: Enhance Familiar II

m.text: a figurine of the familiar worth at least 5,000 gp

entries: The caster engages in a ritual that modifies its familiar for the day. When casting the spell the caster chooses one of the following features:

entries.name: Choose One
entries: Benefit:
{@b Ability Enhancement}: Gain +1 to two for your familiar, (with this, the score may not exceed 4 more than the familiar/companion template's maximum (whichever is greater)).

{@b Caster's Friend II}: The familiar gains the innate spellcaster trait, with a spell from the following list (choosen at the time Enhance Familiar II is cast). The spell takes an action for the Familiar to cast, does not need material components, and can be cast once per short or long rest. The familiar casts spells as if using a second (2nd) level spell slot and 3rd level caster (where applicable). The familiar maintains concentration where such applies, and uses its masters spell proficiency bonsuses and DCs.

entries.name: Choose one from
items: {@spell Aid|PHB}, (Divine Soul Sorcerer or Clerics Only)
{@spell Alter Self|PHB}
{@spell Blur|PHB}
{@spell Catapult|XGE}
{@spell Chaos Shield|DnDWikiWildMagic}, (Wild Magic/Wild Mage only)
{@spell Comprehend Language|XGE}, having the familar
{@spell Detect Evil or Good|XGE}
{@spell Enlarge/Reduce|PHB}, familiar on themself only
{@spell Expeditius Retreat|PHB}
{@spell Hold Monster} - but only on creatures of the same family/type. (An Owl familiar can cast that upon a raptor type beast. But not against an non beast or beasts that are not part birds.
{@spell Mage Hand}, once per short rest
{@spell Pass without Trace|PHB}, (itself only) once per day with a duration of 10 minutes.
{@spell Jump|PHB}, The familiar can jump (itself only) up to three times per day. Each jump has a duration of only one round.
{@spell Longstrider|PHB}
{@spell Shield of faith|PHB}, (Divine Soul Sorcerer, or Abjuration Wizard)
or choose an additional spell and spell slot from the list in {@spell Enhance Familiar I|MMMx}.

entries: {@b Familiar Ambassador II}: The familiar can speak with all beasts. (as per the Cleric/Druid/Ranger spell {@spell speak with animals}) When the familiar talks with Animals of the same general size and family as itself, the familiar gets advantage for social ability checks for any interactions with them.
{@b Familiar Focus I}: spells that the familiar's master targets self, provided the familiar is within 5 ft. should the familiar also is effected.

{@b Familiar Spellstore II}: The Familiar's Master is considered to have the spells its familiar has learned with Enchance Familiar as always prepared while the Familiar is within 5 ft. of its master.
{@b Tough II}: The familiar gains 6 hit points.
If the spell is cast again, the new casting replaces its previous benefit, and additional casting will not stack any of the effects. One and only one can be active at a time.

If the caster casts this spell every day for a year (for that feature), the familiar gains the ability permanently and the material component breaks and requires a new figurine be crafted, and the caster may now cast the spell again choosing another benefit.

entries.name: NOTE for DMs:
entries: {@i As the enhancement of the familiar continues, the familiar should develop a personality that seems almost human, displaying specific traits, likes, dislikes, opinions habits and foibles. It's animal qualities also develop as its personality matures. A black cat might develop discriminating and expensive tastes in food and creature comfort; a crow might become a collector of gaudy gemstones and jewelry; and an otter might develop a frolicsome personality combining a short attention span for serious matters with a love for playful pranks.}

{@i The familiar takes on some of the alignment view and attitudes of its wizard, though leaning toward the neutral alignment, a holdover from its simple animal origin, will always remain. The familiar may tend to become more of an independent NPC as it is enhanced. The DM should carefully consider if relaxing the dependency on the wizard will improve the campaign play.}

spell.name: Enhance Familiar III

m.text: a figurine of the familiar worth at least 7,500 gp

entries: The caster engages in a ritual that modifies its familiar for the day. When casting the spell the caster chooses one of the following features:

entries.name: Choose One
entries: Benefit:
{@b Ability Enhancement}: Gain +1 to two for your familiar, (with this, the score may not exceed 4 more than the familiar/companion template's maximum (whichever is greater)).

{@b Caster's Friend}: The familiar gains the innate spellcaster trait, with a spell from the following list (choosen at the time Enhance Familiar III is cast). The spell takes an action for the Familiar to cast, does not need material components, and can be cast once per short or long rest. The familiar casts spells as if using a third (3nd) level spell slot and 5th level caster (where applicable). The familiar maintains concentration where such applies, and uses its masters spell proficiency bonsuses and DCs.

entries.name: Choose one from:
items: {@spell Beacon of Hope|PHB}, (Divine Soul Sorcerer, Clerics, or Necromancers Only)
{@spell Blink|PHB}
{@spell Dispel Magic|PHB}
{@spell Fly|PHB}, self only
{@spell Meld into Stone|PHB}
{@spell Nonedetection|PHB}, self only (or must remain in contact with the target cast upon)
{@spell Water Breathing|PHB}
or
* choose an additional spell and spell slot from the list in {@spell Enhance Familiar I|5m}.
* choose an additional spell and spell slot from the list in {@spell Enhance Familiar II|5m}.

entries: {@b Familiar Focus II}: The familiar while in contact with its master, counts as an arcane focus and its master (provided the Familiar is not restrained) doesn't use somatic elements in spell casting.
{@b Familiar Sense II}: One of familiar's senses is gained by its Master (ie. Darkvision, Enhanced Smell, etc).

{@b Familiar Token}: The familiar gains the trait {@b False Appearance}, once long rest, the familiar can take the form of a statue of itself which can be 1/2 its normal size. While in this form the familiar effectively is effectively petrified. However the familiar does have awareness of its surroundings, but its range of telepathy/communication is halved, and its master can no longer share its senses.
{@b Tough III}: The familiar gains 8 hit points.
If the spell is cast again, the new casting replaces its previous benefit, and additional casting will not stack any of the effects. One and only one can be active at a time.

If the caster casts this spell every day for a year (for that feature), the familiar gains the ability permanently and the material component breaks and requires a new figurine be crafted, and the caster may now cast the spell again choosing another benefit.

spell.name: Merge with Familiar
entries: You or you familiar/animal companion merges harmlessly into the other's body. For the duration of this spell, you or your familiar/animal companion can separate or merge at will as an action. If you or familiar/animal companion are dropped to 0 hp while the other is merged, any extra damage beyond 0 is dealt to the merged creature and they immediate appear in the same space as the now unconcious creature's body.

spell.name: Callback
entries: If your familiar/animal companion takes hit point damage while within range of this spell, it immediately teleports to your space after the damage is applied. If it's killed, its corpse teleports instead. Optionally, you can specify a number of points of damage for your familiar to take before the spell takes effect. Once the familiar has teleported back to you, the spell ends.

spell.name: Disrupt Link
entries: The target has their link with her bonded creature temporarily severed. If the subject has a familiar, they loses the benefits they have from their familiar/animal companion. If the target has a familiar/animal companion, they lose the benefits of the link, share spells, and devotion abilities. The target and their familiar/animal companion also lose any other abilities that rely on the two having a connection.

item.name: Blanket of Dimness
entries: The Blanket is woven from the fur of displacer beasts. It is difficult to make out the distinct shape of this  gray mantle, as if your eyes are bleary whenever you look directly at it.

If your animal companion is wearing the blanket, as an action you may command the blanket to use its special quality. The blanket casts the Blur spell upon the animal wearing it for a duration of 1 minute. This property can't be used again until after the next dusk.

item.name: Bonding Amulets
entries: These aren't found, they simply appear around a ranger and their companion's necks once they display a genuine unity of character. The amulets are clay coins and bear no adornment, their simplicity belying their power.

While you and your animal companion wear the bonding amulets, if the animal companion is alive and within 50 feet of you, at the end of each short rest you may spend your hit dice to heal your animal companion and the animal companion may spend its hit dice to heal you.

item.name: Cetusian Conch
entries: The Cetusian Conch is a large spiraled shell. Its outer surface is mottled green and blue and its interior is a deep purple. The shell is made by large, semi-intelligent mollusks that are only found in the depths of the Lake of Dragons.
If the conch is crushed into a paste and fed to an animal companion, it allows the animal to breathe water permanently.

item.name: Dragon's Blood
entries: A tiny ruby bottle with a brush cap contains a small amount of dragon's blood.

If the blood is painted onto the claws, horns, beak, or similar appendage of your animal companion, you may permanently treat attacks made with those parts as magical. In addition, damage dealt by the affected body part permanently gains the following damage type, based on the type of dragon that the blood came from:

item.name: Glittering Ribbons
entries: These are small, multicolored ribbons with a distracting metallic sheen. Each ribbon is embroidered with a gold nugget, the symbol of Garl Glittergold.

Once you weave the ribbons into your animal companion's fur or feathers, you may use an action to have the ribbons cast the {@spell Confusion} spell as if expending a 6th level spell slot. The area of effect is centered upon your animal companion but does not effect your animal companion. The save DC is equal to 8 + your  proficiency bonus + either your companion's Strength or Dexterity bonus (your choice). This property can't be used again until after a long rest.

item.name: Graymoss Tendrils
entries: These are thin black filaments of a peculiar moss, coiled within a coin-sized bag. Graymoss is only found growing around sacrificial altars in Yuan-Ti temples.

Once you weave the tendrils into the fur or feathers of your animal companion, your companion becomes wreathed in a smoke that matches the colors of your environment. This grants Advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made by the animal companion.

item.name: Jumping Shoes
entries: These small, enchanted rubber patches are distilled from the latex of a Felsul tree. The latex must be drawn from the tree after it is cut down on a moonless night.
If they are applied to the feet of an animal companion using tree sap, the animal companion may permanently double its long jump and high jump distances.

item.name: Llewyrrian Blinders
entries: These are enchanted blinders crafted by the warriors of the Llewyrr to calm their animal companions in the heat of battle.
Once you place these over your animal companion's eyes, they gain Advantage on all saves against becoming frightened, charmed, or petrified.

item.name: Rod of the Purple Sun
entries: This branding rod is made of an unknown oily metal that causes a feeling of revulsion when it is held. The head is shaped like Cyric's burning sun motif and its metal is tinted purple.

Upon branding your animal companion the rod liquifies and flows into the brand. From this point on, at the start of each combat encounter your animal companion descends into madness. For the remainder of the combat, your companion will always attack on its turn as if you had commanded it to attack. You do not need to spend an action to command it to attack. It will always target the nearest creature, moving to the target by the shortest route necessary. If there are two creatures that are equidistant from the animal companion, it will choose a target at random.

Your animal companion gains an additional bonus to damage rolls equal to half your level. Whenever your companion deals damage to its target, you may choose to have your animal companion perform one of the following:

items: {@b Mighty Sweep}: The animal companion swings at the target and another creature within 5 feet of the target. If the original attack roll would hit the second creature, the second creature takes half the damage inflicted on the initial target.
{@b Daunting Roar}: The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it is frightened of the animal companion until the end of your companion's next turn.
{@b Unbalancing Strike}: The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target is knocked prone.

entries: The Save DC for Daunting Roar and Unbalancing Strike is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + either the animal companion's Strength or Dexterity bonus (whichever is greater).

Once combat ends, if your animal companion attacked a party member while it was maddened, your animal companion must make a Wisdom saving throw against a DC equal to the highest amount of damage it inflicted on any party member in one round. If it fails the saving throw, it will abandon you and flee into the wilderness.
{@b Curse}. Once an animal companion is branded by this item, it must always go mad in combat. The brand can only be removed by a remove curse spell or similar.

item.name: Tears of Akadi
entries: This is a perfectly spherical globule of crystal blue liquid, the actual tears of the primordial Akadi. It has no container, but stays in its form if it is handled gently.
If your animal companion drinks the tears, it's Intelligence permanently increases to 7 (if it wasn't higher already) and it permanently gains the ability to speak Common.

item.name: Collar of Defense +1
entries: The appearance of these collars differ, but these defense collars will most often have a buckle with a shield upon it
A creature with this collar around its neck gains +1 to its AC.

item.name: Collar of Defense +2
entries: The appearance of these collars differ, but these defense collars will most often have a buckle with a shield upon it
A creature with this collar around its neck gains +2 to its AC.

item.name: Collar of Defense +3
entries: The appearance of these collars differ, but these defense collars will most often have a buckle with a shield upon it
A creature with this collar around its neck gains +3 to its AC.

item.name: Collar of Attack +1
entries: The appearance of these collars differ, but these attack collars will most often have studs.
A creature with this collar around its neck gains +1 to attack and damage rolls, and its natural weapons are considered magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance.

item.name: Collar of Attack +2
entries: The appearance of these collars differ, but these attack collars will most often have studs.
A creature with this collar around its neck gains +2 to attack and damage rolls, and its natural weapons are considered magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance.

item.name: Collar of Attack +3
entries: The appearance of these collars differ, but these attack collars will most often have studs.
A creature with this collar around its neck gains +3 to attack and damage rolls, and its natural weapons are considered magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance.

item.name: Collar, Winged
entries: The appearance of these collars differ, but these collars will most often have a stylized tooled emblem of feathers or wings.
A pair of wings spring out of the creature's back that disappear if attunement with this collar ends. While attuned to it, the beast has a flight speed equal to its movement speed.

item.name: Collar of the Awakening
entries: Once attuned to this collar, a beast's intelligence becomes 10. If its intelligence was greater than 10, then it does not change. The beast also becomes able to speak one language (chosen by the collar's maker - typically Common, Druidic, or Elvish).

item.name: Collar of Resistance
entries: The appearance of these collars differ, but these attack collars will most often have a stylized tooled emblem of the damage type: Flames for Fire, Sword for flashing, Hammer for Bludgeoning, etc etc.
While attuned to this collar, the beast has resistance to one damage type. The type is dependant on the collar, and cannot be changed. (The DM chooses the damage type..

item.name: Collar of Shielding
entries: The appearance of these collars differ, but these collars will most often have a stylized tooled emblem of a shield, and are most often colorful.

While attuned to this collar, for one charge the creature (if intelligent 5+) can, as a reaction, benefits from {@spell shield}. If the creature is not intelligent the DM should trigger the shield on the first 5 attacks that trigger the creature - including AoEs which includes it. (instictive flinching)
The Collar regains {@dice d4-1} charges each day.

item.name: Collar of Stoneskin
entries: While attuned to this collar, the beast has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical weapons.

item.name: Caster's Collar
entries: The appearance of these collars differ, but these attack collars will most often have a stylized tooled emblem of the damage type: Flames for Fire, Sword for flashing, Hammer for Bludgeoning, etc etc.

This item actually fills 2 attunement slots. One by the creature, and the other by its parnter/master. While so attuned , the beast becomes a conduit for its the spellcaster's spellcasting- provided it is within 30 ft. of the caster.
A ranger may use her animal companion as the point of origin for casting a spell, instead of herself.
A wizard/warlock may use their familiar.
A druid may use a summoned creature or pet.

item.name: Aquarium Ball
entries: This clear, 1-inch-thick glass orb is the size of a large melon and hangs from a thick chain. It can hold up to 2 gallons of freshwater or saltwater, allowing it to house aquatic creatures such as fish or frogs. The cap near the top of the ball can be unscrewed for access. One Tiny creature or two Diminutive creatures can fit comfortably into an aquarium ball. The water within the orb must be changed daily in order to keep the creatures within alive. Otherwise, the inhabitants begin to slowly suffocate.

item.name: Beast Whistle
entries: This small wooden whistle emits a high-pitched sound like that of a signal whistle, except the signal is audible only to a specific type of creature—other types of creatures hear only a quiet hissing sound.

Beast whistles come in six different varieties: avian, canine, feline, rodent, reptile, and ungulate (other varieties may be available at the GM's discretion). Animals and magical beasts that match a beast whistle's type can hear the whistle as a human hears a signal whistle. Creatures that fit into multiple categories (such as griffons) can usually hear the call of multiple types of whistles, though magical beasts who don't fit into any of the above categories cannot hear a beast whistle. Beast whistles don't function underwater, though creatures underwater may hear a beast whistle sounded from above the surface if they are close enough.

item.name: Clockwork Horse
entries: {@monster clockwork horse} are durable, untiring mounts. However they are very complex to create and maintain, and loud when active.

item.name: Jaguar
entries: {@monster jaguar} are jungle stalkers, suitable as mounts for goblins, halflings, gnomes, and other small folk.
Jaguars however are medium creatures, and so can only be ridden by creatures of category small or less.

item.name: Warhorse Zombie
entries: {@monster warhorse zombie} are the product of necromancy, used alongside warhorse skeletons in the cavalry of undead hordes.
