item.name: Rider's Pack
entries: {@bold Subtype}: Background Equipment Pack

{@bold Description}: Includes a draft horse, bit and bridle, a riding saddle, a pair of saddlebags, 5 days of animal feed, a blanket, a mess kit, 5 torches, a tinderbox, 5 days of rations, and a waterskin. The pack also includes 25 feet of hempen rope.

item.name: Beastrider's Pack
entries: {@bold Subtype}: Background Equipment Pack

{@bold Description}: Includes animal feed (5 days), a backpack, a bedroll, a belt pouch, a bit and bridle, a tinderbox, an iron pot, a mess kit, a riding saddle, 50 feet of hempen rope, saddlebags, soap, 10 torches, rations for 5 days, and waterskin.

item.name: Trapper's Pack
entries: {@bold Subtype}: Background Equipment Pack

{@bold Description}: Includes a tent, a backpack, a bedroll, a mess kit, a hunting trap, a fishing kit, 5 torches, a tinderbox, 5 days of rations, a waterskin, a short bow, and a quiver of 20 arrows. Replace the short bow with a longbow for an extra 20 gp.

item.name: Beast-Training Kit
additionalEntries: An inquisitor's Kit helps the Inquistitor investigate.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Inquisitive Kit includes It includes containers of various shapes and sizes made of glass, metal and wood; fine silk gloves, mundane dusts and brushes; tweezers, picks, and probes; a magnifying lens; inks and quills; chalk and charcoal; parchment sheets; and a small journal.

additionalEntries.name: Animal Handling
entries: Your.

additionalEntries.name: Intimidation
entries: This tool proficiency can augment the benefit of successful checks made to analyze or investigate ancient writings, manuscripts, tomes or canonical works. Helping identify the date of its creation (or reprinting), the author, and construction /value of the work..

additionalEntries.name: Persuasion
entries: This tool proficiency can augment the benefit of successful checks made to analyze or investigate ancient writings, manuscripts, tomes or canonical works. Helping identify the date of its creation (or reprinting), the author, and construction /value of the work..

additionalEntries.name: Beast Master
entries: You may train your pets to have a {@feat trick}, regardless of their current relative level.

item.name: Hunter's Pack (variant)
additionalEntries: The Hunter's pack is useful for rendering and field dressing creatures they slay. Harvesting bits and pieces of the creature for food, arcane rites, alchemical reagents, or smithing.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: This leather tool bag has all you need to field dress your kill. The kit includes 25 ft. of rope, leather gloves, gut hook knife, bowie butcher knife, whetstone, shears, bone saw, crowbar, tongs, pliers, mincing knife, blubber fork, bone spade (to be used with a branch or pole), a hunting trap, and 10 empty vials for samples.

additionalEntries.name: Animal Handling
entries: When you are working with animals, your knowledge of their weak spots an anatomy makes handling them less challenging - or at least less dangerous.

additionalEntries.name: Artisan Tool/Tool kit
entries: This is a fairly complicated one. {@item Leatherworker's Tools}: works in to help with track and barding for exotic animal and help protect a creature's handler from the creature's threat(s). {@item Poisoner's Kit}: Fosters better preparidness in resistance to poison attacks, and helps harvest natural toxins from such.

additionalEntries.name: Survival
entries: With proficiency in this pack, the character is more likely to harvest useable materials for food, alchemical reagents, extracting poisons or toxins, arcane rites or for crafting mundane items.

additionalEntries.name: Harvesting
entries: You can attempt to procure special items from creaures that you've correctly identified (@ability Intelligence), and remember what parts are useful for such.

additionalEntries.name: Choice Cut
entries: When you harvest for your own crafting or cooking, your ability check are done as if using the next tier quality of materials. otherwise the

feat.name: Bonded Companion

prerequisite.other: a pet, animal companion, familiar or steed

entries: You have spent your time bonding with and training your creature to enhance their abilities.
After bonding with a companion you can use future feats to bond further with them as listed below. These additional feats can be taken multiple times.

entries.name: Level up
entries: Your creature gains an additional hit dice in HP permanently and gets a +1 to all attacks.

entries.name: Comforting presence
entries: You always know the direction your creature is and their distance from you as long as they are on the same plane of existence. They also know where to find you.
You can feel their life force no matter where they are and tell when they get injured.
If struck with either the {@condition frigthened} or {@condition charmed} conditions, if their action or innaction puts you in obvious peril, your creature as a reaction gets to roll again to save.

feat.name: Bond of Arcana
entries: Your creature has been learning from you more than you had ever thought possible and can aid you in casting magic.

entries.name: Level up
entries: Your creature has either its Intelligence or Wisdom increased by 1, (the score may not exceed 20 or 2 more than the familiar/companion template's maximum (whichever is greater)).

entries.name: Broadened Mind
entries: Your creature grants you the ability to have one additional spell known every time you take this feat. (If your class does not have this feature then it grants you one additional 1st level spell slot.)

entries.name: Joined Casting
entries: You can ask your creature to aid you in one of the following ways when casting a spell (this takes your creatures's action during their turn.);

items: {@b Targeted}: You gain advantage on any spell that requires a spell attack roll.
{@b Enhanced}: Saving throws from your spells are at disadvantage for the target.
{@b Concentration}: Concentration checks are made with advantage, if you fall unconcious the familiar takes over concentration of the spell.

entries: It must be within 5 ft. of you or a target as you are casting the spell and use the same amount of actions as you do.
Your creature requires a short rest before they can aid your spell casting again. Every time you take this feat your creature can aid you one additional time.

feat.name: Bond of the Guardian
entries: You have taught your creature to be an excellent guard and protector.

entries.name: Level up
entries: Your creature gains +2 its AC
Your creature has either its Intelligence or Wisdom increased by 1, (the score may not exceed 20 or 2 more than the familiar/companion template's maximum (whichever is greater)).

entries.name: Alert
items: Your creature gains proficiency in {@skill perception} and may use your proficiency bonus. If the creature is already proficency in perception, its gains expertise.
Your creature cannot be surprised while its is concious.

feat.name: Bond of the Hunter
entries: You have trained to further enhance your creature's natural instincts to hunt.

entries.name: Level up
entries: Your creature has its Wisdom increased by 1, (the score may not exceed 20 or 2 more than the familiar/companion template's maximum (whichever is greater)).
Your creature gains an additional hit dice in HP permanently. All attacks increase by 1 point.

entries.name: Skilled
entries: Your creature gains proficiency in {@skill investigation} and {@skill survival} and may use your proficiency.
Any survival checks made by your creature gain a +5.
Your creature gains +5 to its initative.

entries.name: Tracking
entries: You can introduce your creature to a friendly entity for it to learn. If you assign your creature a quarry to track, if the quarry teleports or escapes and your creature ever crosses the path of a quarry they have been assigned to in the past, the DMs should roll to pick up the trail again.
Any attempt that a quarry has to detect your creature tracking it is at a disadvantage.

feat.name: Bond of Learning
entries: You have taught your creature to do the things that you can do.

entries.name: Level up
entries: Your creature has one of its attributes increased by 1, (the score may not exceed 20 or 2 more than the familiar/companion template's maximum (whichever is greater)).

entries.name: Skilled
entries: You can choose two skills every time you take this feat. If you choose a skill that your creature already knows, you can increase the proficiency bonus to the same level as yours.
Your creature can use the {@i help} action to aid you with skills it is proficient with, giving you advantage on the relevant roll.

feat.name: Bond of Spirit
entries: Your creature has a stronger spirit bond that it can use to restore you and keep you alive.

entries.name: Level up
entries: Your creature gains an additional hit dice in HP permanently and 1 point of Constitution (the score may not exceed 20 or 4 more than the familiar/companion template's maximum (whichever is greater)).

entries.name: Shared Soul
entries: If you ever lose three death saves, your soul becomes bonded to your creature. While its still alive, it holds you in a stabilised condition which allows for a {@spell revivify} up to 1 hour per caster level.
The same bonding works for your creature: Its soul becomes bonded to you if it ever dies.

You share an empathic bound, and while within a mile of each other are aware of either's emotional state and pains/joys - this grants adavntage for saves against effects that would alter emotional states (Fear; Tasha's Hideous Laughter or the like).

feat.name: Bond of Tooth & Claw
entries: You have trained with your creature to enhance its fighting abilities. If it couldn't attack, it now can.

entries.name: Level up
entries: Your creature gains an additional hit dice in HP permanently. All attacks increase by one level in dice damage (d4 > d6 > d8 > d10 > d12).

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries: While either you or your creature are facing the same creature or within 5 ft. of an enemy the other is targeting, both you and your companion have advantage on your attack rolls.

entries.name: Practiced Manoeuvre
entries: If you successfully damage a foe that your creature is within combat range of, it can use a reaction to attack that creature.
This manoeuvre can be performed only once per short or long rest.

feat.name: Bond of True Sight
entries: You have taught your creature to find hidden things and see through deception.

entries.name: Level up
entries: Your creature gains an additional hit dice in HP permanently. All attacks increase by 1 point.
Your creature has either its Intelligence or Wisdom increased by 1, (the score may not exceed 20 or 4 more than the familiar/companion template's maximum (whichever is greater)).

entries.name: Skilled
entries: Your creature gains proficiency in {@skill investigation} and {@skill perception} and may use your proficiency.
Any time that these skills are used to look for pocketed items, secret compartments, magically disguised things or hidden doors your creature gains an additional +5 on the rolls.

entries.name: Sniff out lies
entries: If your creature is with you during social encounters, you gain advantage on rolls to see through any deception.

feat.name: Bonded Feature
entries: Your
When you gain a feat that increases an ability score, your bonded animal gains 1 point in that same ability.
Your creature gains 1 point in an atrribute of your choice and may choose one {@filter Evolutionary Enhancement|optionalfeature|type=EA}.
{@i Your creature cannot increase its ability score through this feat may not exceed 20 or 4 more than the familiar/companion template's maximum (whichever is greater)

feat.name: Menagerie
entries: You gain the ability to have a second Familiar, Mount or Animal Companion active.
Summoned/Conjured creature have maximum HP.

optionalfeature.name: Guardian
entries: Your creature gains the Guard action; Your beast may be designated to defend a position or person. You may define the creature or area (15-foot cube) - the creature will attempt to Charisma (Intimidate) creature it doesn't know (that it perceives) within sight of what it is guarding. If its unsuccessful and it or what it is guarding is attacked,  it takes feral attacks against those that attack whom they are defending. (Feral attacks are: Full attack actions, separate from your Ranger's actions. It takes a full action to call off a feral Attack once its begun, and may require you to make a Wisdom(Animal Handling) check to gain control of the animal.)

optionalfeature.name: Greater
entries: Your beast companion either grows or may now be or category large in size when you summon it.

optionalfeature.name: Pack Mule
entries: Your creature counts as one size larger for carry/lift capacity as well as for mounted combat.

optionalfeature.name: Slippery
entries: Your creature may take a bonus action to use either the dash or disengage actions.

optionalfeature.name: Stalker
entries: Your creature can take the Hide Action as a bonus action. If it doesn't have proficiency in Stealth, it gains such, if it does already, it gains Expertise. Unless you wish it not, your companion automatically hides when you do.
Increase your creature's Dexterity score by 1 (the score may not exceed 20 or 4 more than the familiar/companion template's maximum (whichever is greater)

optionalfeature.name: Alert
entries: You have trained your beast creature to be alert (it may 'keep watch' for a period of up to 4 hours while you rest). You add your proficiency bonus to the beast's passive perception and to any perception (wisdom) ability check it makes. The beast immediately attempts to alert you if it notices anything.

optionalfeature.name: Defensive
entries: Companion gain +1 to AC and all saving throws.
Increase your creature's Constitution score by 1 (the score may not exceed 20 or 4 more than the familiar/companion template's maximum (whichever is greater)

optionalfeature.name: Fortitude
entries: Increases your creature's hit point maximum by 1d6 + 5.
Increase your creature's Constitution score by 1 (the score may not exceed 20 or 4 more than the familiar/companion template's maximum (whichever is greater)

optionalfeature.name: Menagerie
entries: You may have 1 additional companion active, your total CR for all companions may not exceed your Beast Template CR for your level. (attack action economy is preserved).

optionalfeature.name: Mobility
entries: Your creature gain +10 to their Move.
Increase your creature's Constitution score by 1 (the score may not exceed 20 or 4 more than the familiar/companion template's maximum (whichever is greater)

optionalfeature.name: Skilled
entries: Your creature gains +1 to skills ability checks. (if taken twice the creature gains the Jack of All Trades feature).

optionalfeature.name: Trained
entries: 2 Beast Tricks (see {@filter Exceptional Training|optionalfeature|type=ET}).
Increase either your creature's Intelligence or Charisma score by 1 (the score may not exceed 20 or 4 more than the familiar/companion template's maximum (whichever is greater)

optionalfeature.name: Power
entries: Increase single attack damage die by 1 step (max 2d8).
Increase your creature's Strength score by 1 (the score may not exceed 20 or 4 more than the familiar/companion template's maximum (whichever is greater)

optionalfeature.name: Rescue
entries: You can command your beast companion to pull an incapacitated creature away from danger.

optionalfeature.name: Threaten
entries: You command your beast companion to threaten a creature that is no more than 15 feet away from your beast. The creature must make a wisdom saving throw or be frightened of your beast until the end of your next turn. The beast can only frighten creatures with a challenge rating less than your current ranger level. The DC is equal to 8 + the beast's constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Barding
entries: You have trained your creature to use armor made for it. It gains proficiency in light armor. If you further train a beast by teaching it this trick again then the beast gains proficiency in medium armor, and for a third-time proficiency in heavy armor.

optionalfeature.name: Defend
entries: You command your creature to defend an ally that is 5 feet away from your beast. If the designated ally moves on its turn, the beast moves with them up to its speed in distance. If a hostile creature attacks the ally while your beast is next to them, the beast uses its reaction to move within reach of the hostile creature and make an opportunity attack.

optionalfeature.name: Distract
entries: You command your creature to distract a nearby creature. The beast takes the help action to aid you or a friendly creature in attacking or rolling a Dexterity ability check (Either the target being distracted or you or your ally must be within 15 feet of your companion).

optionalfeature.name: Fetch
entries: You command your creature to fetch an object within reach. If this object is being held by a creature the beast takes the disarm (Dungeon Master's Guide, page 271) action against the creature. If successful, the beast grabs the item.

optionalfeature.name: Track
entries: You command your creature to take up the scent of a creature that is either within 30 feet of the beast, or your have an item with their scent. So long as you continue to command the beast to track on subsequent turns (which it can do even if the target being tracked moves away or becomes hidden or invisible) you gain a +10 bonus to survival (wisdom) and perception (wisdom) ability checks to track or detect the creature.
If the creature being tracked teleports or travels more than

optionalfeature.name: Lick Wounds
entries: When either or both Your creature and you spend HD to regain HP during a short rest both of you regain the sum of the result from the roll(s).

optionalfeature.name: Dire Familiar
entries: As an action, you can bolster your summoned familiar. For 1 minute, your familiar's current and maximum hit points is increased by your witch level and it gains a bonus to its damage rolls equal to your Charisma modifier.
You can cast other hexes while this hex is in effect. Once you cast this hex, you can't cast it again until your familiar is dismissed, or until its duration expires.
You must have the Familiar feature to choose this hex.

optionalfeature.name: Evasive
entries: Your creature gains the Rogue's Evasion ability.
Increase your creature's Dexterity score by 1 (the score may not exceed 20 or 4 more than the familiar/companion template's maximum (whichever is greater)

optionalfeature.name: Mystic
entries: Your creature's natural weapons are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming damage resistance.

optionalfeature.name: Shared Spells
entries: When you cast a spell targeting yourself, you can also affect your creature(s) with the spell if the creature(s) is within 60 feet of you. You must spend an HD for each additional beast beyond the first being affected.

optionalfeature.name: Saddle
entries: You train your creature to allow a smaller creature than itself to mount and ride it. The beast only allows familiar creatures to mount it unless it is commanded otherwise. You can only train a flying beast this trick when your ranger class is level 15.

optionalfeature.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, your animal companion can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

optionalfeature.name: Amphibious
entries: Your animal companion can breathe air and water.

optionalfeature.name: Breath Weapon
entries: Your animal companion can exhale a type of elemental energy. It gains the Breath Weapon trait from the Dragonborn race.

optionalfeature.name: Cunning
entries: Your animal companion has advantage on saving throws against being charmed.

optionalfeature.name: Darkvision
entries: Your animal companion has darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Dive Attack
entries: If the animal companion is flying and dives at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee attack, the attack deals an extra 4 (1d8) damage to the target.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Body
entries: A creature that touches your animal companion or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 (1d8) elemental damage. You choose the type of elemental damage this features deals when this feature is taken.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Resistance
entries: Choose a damage type that isn't bludgeoning, force, slashing, or piercing. Your animal companion has resistance to damage of that type.

optionalfeature.name: False Appearance
entries: Your animal companion can blend in to the world in a unique way. While it remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from one specific type of object such as a dead shrub or rock.

optionalfeature.name: Familiar
entries: Your animal companion becomes a permanent quasi-familiar. When you cast a spell with a range of touch, your animal companion can deliver the spell as if it had cast the spell. Your animal companion must be within 100 feet of you, and it must use its reaction to deliver the spell when you cast it. If the spell requires an attack roll, you use your attack modifier for the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Hold Breath
entries: Your animal companion can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

optionalfeature.name: Iron Scent
entries: Your animal companion can pinpoint, by scent, the location of ferrous metal within 30 feet of it.

optionalfeature.name: Keen Senses
entries: Choose two between hearing, sight, and smell. Your animal companion has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on those two senses.

optionalfeature.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: Your animal companion can magically transmit simple messages and images to any creature within 120 feet of it that can understand a language. This form of telepathy doesn't allow the receiving creature to telepathically respond.

optionalfeature.name: Locomotion
entries: Your animal companion can move in a unique way. Choose from burrow, climb, fly, or swim. Your animal companion gains that type of movement speed with a value equal to its base speed -5 ft.

optionalfeature.name: Mimicry
entries: Your animal companion can mimic any sounds it has heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Wisdom (Insight) check with a DC equal to your companion's Feature Save DC.

optionalfeature.name: Mount
entries: Your animal companion is large enough to be ridden by you. Unlike most mountable creatures, your animal companion can be your size or larger. It cannot be smaller than your size to take this Wild Feature.

optionalfeature.name: Multiple Heads
entries: You animal companion has more than one head. It gains an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks. You can select this Wild Feature multiple times. Each time your animal companion gains a new head which, in turn, gains an extra reaction that can be use only for opportunity attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Natural Attack
entries: Your animal companion gains a new way to attack. This new attack deals 1d6 damage and you choose the type of damage the attack does and which ability score, except Constitution, the attack uses for its attack and damage bonuses. Melee attacks have a reach of 5 ft. and ranged attacks have a range of 25/50 ft.

optionalfeature.name: Natural Camouflage
entries: Your animal companion has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in one favored terrain of your choice from the Ranger's Natural Explorer class feature.

optionalfeature.name: Natural Defenses
entries: Your animal companion increases its Armor Class by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Nimble
entries: Your animal companion is particularly quick. Its base land speed increases by 5 ft.

optionalfeature.name: Poisonous
entries: Your animal companion's basic attack deals an additional 2 (1d4) poison damage.

optionalfeature.name: Powerful Attack
entries: Your animal companion's basic attack increases its damage die by one size.

optionalfeature.name: Reach
entries: Your animal companion increase the range of one of its melee attacks by 5 feet. You can select this Wild Feature multiple times. Each time it is taken, choose a different melee attack.

optionalfeature.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, your animal companion can gain advantage on all melee attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Shared Senses
entries: You can use a bonus action to transfer your senses into those of your animal companion. You can see, hear, and smell anything that it can. Your animal companion must be within 10 miles of you to use this feature.

optionalfeature.name: Skulk
entries: Your animal companion can take the Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns. Sleepless Your animal companion cannot be put to sleep with magic.

optionalfeature.name: Slippery
entries: Your animal companion is slick to the touch. It has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple or being restrained.

optionalfeature.name: Standing Leap
entries: Your animal companion's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

optionalfeature.name: Stench
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of your animal companion must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to its Stench for 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Sticky
entries: Your animal companion is sticky to the touch. Attempts it makes to make or maintain a grapple have advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Trained
entries: Your animal companion gains proficiency in two skills of your choice. You can take this Wild Feature multiple times. Each time it is taken, select two different skills your animal companion gains proficiency with.

optionalfeature.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: Your animal companion's Armor Class equals 10 + its Dexterity modifier + its Constitution or Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Web Weaver
entries: Your animal companion ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing and gains the following action:

{@b Web (Recharge 5-6)}. {@i Ranged Weapon Attack}: Dexterity modifier + Proficiency modifier to hit, range 30/60 ft., one Large or smaller creature. Hit: The creature is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained creature can make a Strength check against your Feature Save DC, escaping the webbing on a success. The effect ends if the webbing is destroyed. The webbing has AC 10, 5 hit points, resistance to bludgeoning damage, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Ambusher
entries: Your animal companion has advantage on attack rolls against any creature is has surprised. Amorphous Your animal companion can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. Armored Your animal companion increases its Armor Class by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Avoidance
entries: Choose one ability score. If your animal companion is subjected to a spell or effect that allows it to make a saving throw with that ability score to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

optionalfeature.name: Charger
entries: Your animal companion gains the Charger feat.

optionalfeature.name: Confer Elemental Resistance
entries: Your animal companion can grant resistance to damage it resists to anyone riding it. Your animal companion must have the Elemental Resistance and Mount Wild Features to take Confer Elemental Resistance.

optionalfeature.name: Constrict
entries: Your animal companion can crush creatures it grapples. As a bonus action, when the companion has a creature grappled it can deal 1d8 + Strength modifier damage to the grappled creature.

optionalfeature.name: Damage Transfer
entries: While grappling a creature, your animal companion takes only half the damage dealt to it (rounded down), and that creature takes the other half.

optionalfeature.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede your animal companion's darkvision. Your animal companion must have the Darkvision Wild Feature to take Devil's Sight.

optionalfeature.name: Displacement
entries: Your animal companion projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this feature is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This feature is also disrupted while the animal companion is incapacitated or has a speed of 0.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Immunity
entries: Your animal companion becomes immune to one type of elemental damage. It must have the Elemental Resistance Wild Feature and it must choose an energy type it already has resistance to when taking this Wild Feature.

optionalfeature.name: Hemorrhaging
entries: Your animal companion's attacks cause deep internal or external bleeding on creatures struck by its basic attack. When a struck creature starts their turn, the target loses 4 (1d8) hit points due to blood loss. At the end of each of the creatures turn it can attempt a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your animal companion's Strength modifier + its proficiency modifier to end this effect. Magical healing or regeneration also end this effect.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Difficulty
entries: You animal companion is more skilled in the use of its abilities. It increases the DC of its Wild Features by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: Your animal companion gains the ability to cast spells. It gains the Magic Initiate feat, though the DC of its spells are still determined by its Feature Save DC.

optionalfeature.name: Invisibility
entries: Your animal companion can cast the invisibility spell on itself at-will. Casting the spell is a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Magic Attacks
entries: Your animal companion's basic attack counts as magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

optionalfeature.name: Pack Tactics
entries: Your animal companion has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of its allies are within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't incapacitated.

optionalfeature.name: Petrifying Attack
entries: One of your animal companion's weapon attacks can petrify creature struck by it. Choose one of its weapon attacks. Creatures hit by this attack must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against being magically petrified. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified for 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Rampage
entries: When your animal companion reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, it can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a basic attack.

optionalfeature.name: Rust Metal
entries: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits your animal companion corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits it is destroyed after dealing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Siege Monster
entries: Your animal companion deals double damage to objects and structures.

optionalfeature.name: Tunneler
entries: Your animal companion can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a tunnel equal to half its Size in its wake.

optionalfeature.name: Venomous
entries: Your animal companion's basic attack is venomous. Creatures hit by its attack must make a DC 14 Constiution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is poisoned until the end of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Wounded Fury
entries: While you or your animal companion have 10 hit points or fewer, your animal companion has advantage on attack rolls. In addition, it deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage to any target it hits with a melee attack.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: Your animal companion deals 3 (1d6) extra damage and has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all of its hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Your animal companion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

optionalfeature.name: Magical Hide
entries: Your animal companion gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Masterful Difficulty
entries: Your animal companion is a master at using its abilities. It increases the DC of its Wild Features by 1. This Wild Feature stacks with the Improved Difficulty Wild Feature.

optionalfeature.name: Regeneration
entries: Your animal companion regains its proficiency modifier in hit points at the beginning of its turn. Choose two damage types. If the animal companion takes damage of either type, this Wild Feature doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The animal companion dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

optionalfeature.name: Treestride
entries: Once on your animal companion's turn, it can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one living tree within its reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be Large or bigger.

optionalfeature.name: Truesight
entries: Your animal companion gains truesight out to a range of 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Aberration
entries: It takes a special type of person to raise an aberration. Their minds are completely alien and their thought processes inscrutable, but if raised in the right, albeit strange, way, an aberration can make a loyal and loving companion.
{@b Ability Score Increase}:  Your animal companion's Strength and Constitution scores increase by 1.
{@b Bonus Wild Feature}: Your animal companion starts with the Elemental Resistance (Psychic) Wild Feature.
{@b Training Modifier}:The DC of training checks involving aberrations are increased by 2.

optionalfeature.name: Beast
entries: Mundane creatures, beasts are iconic, familiar creatures that many adventurers seek to raise and tame. To say there is nothing extraordinary about the humble beast would be a blatant falsehood. With the right guidance and training, they can be just as dangerous as even the most magical of creatures.
{@b Ability Score Increase}: One of your animal companion's ability scores of your choice increases by 1.
{@b Bonus Wild Feature}:Your animal companion starts with any two Low Tier Wild Features.
{@b Training Modifier}: The DC of training checks involving beasts are decreased by 2.

optionalfeature.name: Celestial
entries: Creatures touched by the raw power of goodness. They are usually more intelligent than other companions and may even be capable of speech. They range from the simple divinity-touched dog to entities as intelligence as the couatl.
{@b Ability Score Increase}:  Your animal companion's Charisma score increases by 1.
{@b Bonus Wild Feature}: Your animal companion starts with the Elemental Resistance (Radiant) and either the Locomotion (Flight) or Trained Wild Features.
{@b Training Modifier}: The DC of training checks involving celestials are decreased by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon
entries: Creatures with dragon blood often share the attitude of the forebears, but not always. What they do always share is the ability to breath some sort of potent energy and a thick, scaly hide. Dragons need not be pureblooded dragon whelps but also encompass partial dragon beasts, drakes, and more.
{@b Ability Score Increase}: Your animal companion's Constitution score increases by 1.
{@b Bonus Wild Feature}: Your animal companion starts with Elemental Breath and Natural Defenses Wild Features.
{@b Training Modifier}: The DC of training checks involving dragons are increased by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental
entries: Hailing from or touched by one of the elemental planes, these creatures are the elements incarnate. Birds of rolling thunder, small puddles of sentient water, and rock eating burrowers are all examples of these diverse and mighty creatures.
{@b Ability Score Increase}: Your animal companion's Dexterity score increases by 1.
{@b Bonus Wild Feature}: Your animal companion starts with the Elemental Immunity (any one) Wild Feature.
{@b Training Modifier}: The DC of training checks involving elementals are increased by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Fey
entries: Hailing from or touched by the ancestral land of the elves, fey creatures are often quite capricious and exceedingly playful. At home in the untamed wilds or the culture of city life, fey creatures enjoy playful tricks though the nature of such gaffes and why they are enacted might vary based on their temperament.
{@b Ability Score Increase}: Your animal companion's Charisma score increases by 1.
{@b Bonus Wild Feature}: Your animal companion starts with Cunning and Sleepless Wild Features.
{@b Training Modifier}: The DC of training checks involving fey are increased by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Fiend
entries: The antithesis of celestials, fiendish creatures hail from or are descended from the Lower Planes. Almost all stand tall in the face of even the most sweltering heat and possess some manner of minor magic ability.
{@b Ability Score Increase}: Your animal companion's Intelligence score increases by 1.
{@b Bonus Wild Feature}: Your animal companion starts with Elemental Resistance (Fire) and Innate Spellcasting Wild Features.
{@b Training Modifier}: The DC of training checks involving fiends are increased by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Monstrosity
entries: Unlike intelligent monstrosities, such as minotaurs and snakefolk, this origin is a catchall that covers creatures not of the ordinary. Magical experiments, curses, and other sources are all possible ways that a monstrosity's lineage may have come into existence. What's important is that, despite their classification as monstrosities, these creatures are still able to be trained.
{@b Ability Score Increase}: Your animal companion's Strength or Constitution score increases by 1.
{@b Bonus Wild Feature}: Your animal companion starts with Keen Senses and one additional Low Tier Wild Feature.
{@b Training Modifier}: The DC of training checks involving monstrosities are increased by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Ooze
entries: With no brains to speak of, many believe oozes are impossible to train or befriend. They are mistaken. Training an ooze is no easy task, but it is possible. These gelatinous creatures are intelligent enough to determine a reliable food source and whether or not they truly love their handler is a hot button issue amongst beast tamers.
{@b Ability Score Increase}: Your animal companion's Dexterity score increases by 1.
{@b Bonus Wild Feature}: Your animal companion starts with Amorphous and Elemental Resistance (Poison) Wild Feature.
{@b Training Modifier}: The DC of training checks involving oozes are increased by 2.

optionalfeature.name: Plant
entries: Intelligent and often predatory flora, plant creatures are just as varied as mundane, motionless plantlife. Poisonous spores, wrapping vines, and natural camouflage help plant creatures stand out from other animal companions while actually blending in.
{@b Ability Score Increase}: Your animal companion's Strength or Charisma score increases by 1.
{@b Bonus Wild Feature}: Your animal companion starts with Elemental Resistance (Poison) and False Appearance Wild Feature.
{@b Fire Vulnerability}: Your animal companion is vulnerable to fire damage.
{@b Training Modifier}: The DC of training checks involving plants are decreased by 1.

table.name: How did you Acquire your patron
colLabels: How Did you Acquire your Patron
intro: The following table offers twelve example encounters that brought a warlock and a young patron together.
rows: Sie haben Ihren M√§zen auf einem Schwarzmarkt zum Verkauf gefunden. Als Sie aufeinander aufmerksam wurden, war die Verbindung sofort da. Haben Sie Ihren G√∂nner gekauft oder haben Sie ihn auf andere Weise erhalten?

Auf der Suche nach einem Unterschlupf vor einem Sturm sind Sie und der Gast am selben sicheren Ort gelandet. Sie vereinbarten, den Platz gemeinsam zu nutzen, um das Unwetter abzuwarten. Im Laufe der Nacht kamen Sie beide ins Gespr√§ch und erfuhren von den Bed√ºrfnissen des jeweils anderen. Sie kamen √ºberein, Hexenmeister und G√∂nner zu werden, und seitdem arbeiten Sie beide zusammen.

Die Eltern des Patrons wurden aggressiv und mussten eingeschl√§fert werden. Sie beschlossen, die Kreatur zu adoptieren, anstatt sie zu verlassen. Ihre Beziehung war anfangs sehr schwierig. Hat es sich seitdem beruhigt oder ist es immer noch manchmal angespannt?

Du hast das Ei des Schutzpatrons (oder seine S√§uglingsform) in der H√∂hle eines Zauberk√ºnstlers gefunden. Es sah so aus, als w√ºrde der Zauberer ein Ritual an dem Ei durchf√ºhren, bevor du ihn besiegst. Du hast dich um das Ei gek√ºmmert und die Kreatur hat dich gepr√§gt.

In einer sternenklaren Nacht in der Wildnis h√∂rtest du ein einsames Lied in der Nachtluft. Als du die Quelle dieser ersch√ºtternden Melodie gefunden hast, hast du den Patron entdeckt. Wor√ºber war dein Schutzpatron so verzweifelt? Warum hast du beschlossen, ihm zu helfen?

Dein Schutzpatron wurde von anderen, gr√∂√üeren Kreaturen gejagt, die ihn fressen wollten. Du hast eingegriffen und sie gerettet. Im Laufe dieses Kampfes hast du gelernt, dass deine eigenen F√§higkeiten nicht ausreichen. Dein G√∂nner bot dir einen Handel an, und du nahmst an und wurdest sein Hexenmeister.

Eine erwachsene Version deines Patrons erschien vor dir, der jugendliche Patron an seiner Seite. Sie zwangen dir deinen Patron auf und bestanden darauf, dass du bei seiner Aufzucht hilfst und sein Diener wirst. Du hast √ºberlebt, weil du ihren Bedingungen bedingungslos zugestimmt hast.

Ein Freund von dir war der urspr√ºngliche Hexenmeister deines G√∂nners. Leider ist er gestorben. Warum wurdest du der neue Hexenmeister deines G√∂nners? Versucht der G√∂nner zu verbergen, wie sehr er deinen Freund vermisst? Wie hat sich dies auf Ihre Beziehung ausgewirkt?

Auf einer Reise wachten Sie eines Nachts auf und fanden den Patron in Ihrem Rucksack, der Ihre Rationen und andere Vorr√§te verschlang. Die ausgehungerte Kreatur war zun√§chst feindselig, als Sie versuchten, Ihr Essen zur√ºckzubekommen. Wie hast du ihr Vertrauen gewonnen? Haben Sie mehr Essen angeboten? Vielleicht etwas Wasser? Was an dieser Interaktion hat Sie so √ºberzeugt, dass Sie ein Hexenmeister werden wollten?

Ihr G√∂nner hat sich besonders um Sie bem√ºht. Vielleicht stand er eines Morgens vor deiner T√ºr oder auf deinem Lagerplatz und verlangte, dass du einen Pakt mit ihm schlie√üt. Warum wurdest du ausgew√§hlt? Wisst ihr das √ºberhaupt? Finde den Grund mit deinem Kerkermeister heraus und √ºberlege, ob dein Hexenmeister ihn kennt.

Sie und Ihr G√∂nner sind genau zur gleichen Zeit gestorben. Euer beider Tod war ein ungeplanter Unfall, und die Gottheit des Todes hat sich bei euch beiden pers√∂nlich entschuldigt. Leider konnte sie euch beide nicht wiederbeleben, ohne eure Seelen zu vermischen. Nun sind Sie und der Patron f√ºr immer miteinander verbunden. Was halten Sie beide von dieser Vereinbarung?

Als Sie eines Nachts schliefen, hatten Sie einen seltsamen Traum. In diesem Traum bat der G√∂nner Sie um Ihre Hilfe. Hast du versucht, den Traum zu ignorieren oder ihn bereitwillig anzunehmen? Wie auch immer, Sie suchten den G√∂nner durch diese mysteri√∂sen Zeichen und fanden schlie√ülich zueinander.

table.name: Baby Beastiary - Mishap
table.caption: Mishap
rows: Der tierische Begleiter verliert den Respekt vor seinem Herrn und glaubt, dass er das Alphatier ist. Der Fehlschlag z√§hlt als zwei Fehlschl√§ge, und der tierische Begleiter verh√§lt sich so, dass er seine neue √úberzeugung von √úberlegenheit zum Ausdruck bringt, bis der Meister bei einer Trainingskontrolle erfolgreich ist.
Der tierische Begleiter ist unnahbar. Er reagiert nicht auf Training und schl√§ft bis sp√§t in den Tag hinein. Sie sind gereizt, wenn sie fr√ºh geweckt werden.
Der tierische Begleiter ist in den n√§chsten Tagen extrem anschmiegsam. Er schleicht sich in Schlafs√§cke, Zelte oder Betten und stiehlt dem Bewohner die Decken.
Der tierische Begleiter setzt sich hin und weigert sich f√ºr eine unangenehme Zeitspanne, sich zu bewegen. Bei dem Versuch, ihn zu bewegen, muss der tierische Begleiter einen St√§rke-Check ablegen.
Der tierische Begleiter macht es sich zur Gewohnheit, so zu tun, als h√∂re er seinen Herrn nicht. Er h√∂rt sie ganz offensichtlich, aber er tut immer so, als ob er sie nicht h√∂ren w√ºrde.

Der tierische Begleiter vernichtet etwas Wichtiges. Egal, ob es sich um einen Brief des K√∂nigs, ein wertvolles Familienerbst√ºck oder ein St√ºck Essen handelt, das jemand in der Gruppe aufbewahrt hat, der tierische Begleiter zerst√∂rt es irgendwie.

Der tierische Begleiter wird hungrig und beschlie√üt, die Dinge selbst in die Hand zu nehmen. Sie durchw√ºhlen die Habseligkeiten der Gruppe, fressen Vorr√§te und bringen generell alles durcheinander.

Der tierische Begleiter beschlie√üt, dass Verstecken spielen eine gute Idee ist. Er versteckt sich in der Gegend und muss gefunden werden. Wenn der Meister oder die Gruppe den tierischen Begleiter nicht innerhalb einer angemessenen Zeitspanne finden kann, verl√§sst er sein Versteck und kehrt zur Gruppe zur√ºck. Allerdings hat es f√ºr den Rest des Tages schlechte Laune.
Der tierische Begleiter ist f√ºr den Rest der Woche m√ºrrisch und schmollend. Er neigt dazu, sich am Rande der Lagerpl√§tze der Gruppe aufzuhalten und schmollt aus irgendeinem Grund.

Der tierische Begleiter bleibt √ºber die Schlafenszeit hinaus wach und weckt sein Herrchen, um die ganze Nacht zu spielen. Der Meister und m√∂glicherweise die gesamte Gruppe kommen in dieser Nacht nicht in den Genuss einer vollst√§ndigen Erholung.

Bei der n√§chsten Begegnung ist der tierische Begleiter abgelenkt. Er sieht etwas Kleines, z. B. einen Schmetterling oder ein Eichh√∂rnchen, das seine Aufmerksamkeit erregt, und rennt los, um es zu jagen.
Der tierische Begleiter wandert nachts weg und ist am Morgen nicht leicht zu finden. Das Herrchen muss es suchen, sonst verliert es den tierischen Begleiter m√∂glicherweise f√ºr immer.

Der tierische Begleiter starrt st√§ndig auf etwas in der Ferne, das niemand sonst sehen kann. Versuche, herauszufinden, was er anstarrt, selbst mit magischer Hilfe, f√ºhren zu nichts Ungew√∂hnlichem. Versuche, dem tierischen Begleiter dies zu erkl√§ren, scheitern und er starrt weiterhin in zuf√§lligen Momenten ins Leere, gerade lange genug, um den Meister oder die Gruppe zu verunsichern.

Der tierische Begleiter wird neugierig auf etwas im Lager oder im Haus der Gruppe. Sie regen sich auf und picken an diesem Gegenstand herum, bis sie eine kleine Katastrophe verursachen. Ein Zelt st√ºrzt auf seinen Bewohner, ein Regal in der K√ºche f√§llt um und zerbricht, oder eine andere kleine Unannehmlichkeit resultiert aus seiner Neugierde.

Der tierische Begleiter versteckt etwas von geringem Wert f√ºr seinen Herrn. Einige Kreaturen k√∂nnten den Gegenstand vergraben, w√§hrend andere ihn einfach fressen k√∂nnten. Der verlorene Gegenstand ist nicht von Bedeutung, aber sein Verlust sollte ein kleines √Ñrgernis sein.

Der tierische Begleiter beschlie√üt, dass Schleichen nicht wichtig ist. Das n√§chste Mal, wenn er seinen Herrn begleitet und dieser eine Geschicklichkeitsprobe macht, hat der Herr aufgrund der Possen des Begleiters einen Nachteil bei der Probe.

Der tierische Begleiter bleibt in etwas stecken, aus dem er sich nicht befreien kann. Er k√∂nnte auf einen Baum klettern und nicht mehr herunterkommen, in einer H√∂hle stecken bleiben oder sich anderweitig festhalten.

Der tierische Begleiter sehnt sich nach k√∂rperlicher Zuwendung. Bei jeder Gelegenheit bem√ºht er sich, gestreichelt zu werden. Ob das nun bedeutet, dass es die Hand seines Herrchens oder Frauchens streichelt oder sich an seinem Bein reibt, es wird f√ºr eine unangenehme Zeitspanne zu einem alles verzehrenden Akt.

Der Appetit des tierischen Begleiters w√§chst. Er frisst viel mehr als sonst bei den Mahlzeiten und gibt sich alle M√ºhe, sein Herrchen oder Frauchen dazu zu bringen, ihm von deren Tellern etwas zu geben.

Der tierische Begleiter hat die Offenbarung, dass sein Herrchen oder Frauchen wirklich versucht, sich so gut wie m√∂glich um ihn zu k√ºmmern. Sie sind auf ihre eigene Art und Weise einf√ºhlsam gegen√ºber den Versuchen ihres Herrn, auch wenn dessen Methoden nicht ihren Vorlieben entsprechen. Der tierische Begleiter zeigt bei der n√§chsten Interaktion Liebe zu seinem Herrn
